channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Billionaire Paul Marshall Nears Deal to Buy Britain's Spectator Magazine for Over $131 Million
item.description: Hedge-fund billionaire Paul Marshall is nearing a deal to acquire Britain’s Spectator magazine for more than $131 million, as the would-be media mogul...

item.title: Fed chief signals in Jackson Hole that weak August jobs data would punch ticket to half-point rate cut
item.description: Chair Jerome Powell strikes dramatic rate-cut tone cuts while keeping all options on Fed’s table.

item.title: Messing Up the Closest Thing to a Sure Thing in the Stock Market
item.description: Index funds are a great way to match the performance of the market. So why do so many investors end up falling short?

item.title: Whoops! You missed the gold boom.
item.description: If you think your stocks have been doing well this year, look at gold.

item.title: Data-Center Owners Get an Edge Over Big Tech Tenants, Finally
item.description: An artificial-intelligence land grab is lifting shares of the centers’ landlords, such as Equinix, after years of mediocre rent growth.

item.title: Peloton’s stock has rallied too much to justify buying any more, analyst says
item.description: Peloton’s stock followed a record rally with another gain on Friday, but J.P. Morgan recommended investors stop buying because although quarterly resu...

item.title: The New Etiquette of Negotiating With Your Real-Estate Agent
item.description: What buyers should look out for in agent agreements.

item.title: This mortgage lender is gearing up for soaring volume as interest rates decline
item.description: Also: Powell’s dovish words, income investments and more trouble for the Moneyist.

item.title: A Time-Honored Strategy Puts Your Retirement at Risk of Financial Ruin
item.description: The tried-and-true 60/40 portfolio and 4% withdrawal rate in retirement could lead to “catastrophic” outcomes if markets behave differently than in th...

item.title: Powell’s Jackson Hole comments put mortgage rates on downward path to 6%, economists say
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Friday signaled a willingness to cut interest rates, which will likely push mortgage rates down in the near ter...
